[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Healthcare Management System (HMS) defines requirements for patient scheduling, medical records, communication, and billing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: HMS allows patients to manage care and payments; providers can access records, prescribe, and communicate.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: HMS integrates with labs, pharmacies, and insurance providers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: HMS provides a web and mobile UI for patients, providers, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: HMS supports desktops, tablets, kiosks, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: HMS uses REST APIs, authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: HMS supports notifications, messaging, and teleconsultations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: HMS optimizes storage for medical records and transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: HMS supports registration, scheduling, prescriptions, and payments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: HMS customizes services based on user preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: HMS connects with insurance claims, diagnostics, and telemedicine services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: HMS provides appointment booking, medical records access, prescriptions, payments, and reports.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: HMS serves patients, healthcare providers, pharmacists, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: HMS requires internet access for online services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: HMS depends on external medical systems and secure authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: HIPAA: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow patients to book healthcare appointments and access records.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide healthcare professionals with access to patient records and scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with pharmacies and insurance providers for e-prescriptions and billing.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable patients to manage appointments, access medical records, receive reminders, and make secure payments (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow providers to manage schedules, update patient records, prescribe medications, and communicate securely (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate reports on patient feedback, appointment statistics, and provider availability (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall ensure secure online payments for medical services and transactions (REQ-INTF-003, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an accessible UI with options for visually and mobility-impaired users.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process user actions within 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store patient records, appointments, prescriptions, and transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure HIPAA-compliant encryption and access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with HIPAA and GDPR data privacy regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted data storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate scheduling, records, prescriptions, and security.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Healthcare IT standards, medical record management practices, and HIPAA policies.
